com.moblima.movie

Class MovieControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moblima.movie.MovieControl

  • public class MovieControl
extends java.lang.Object
    MovieControl connects the user to the program Methods in this class will be called by the boundary of the program to manipulate Movie, MovieShowing and Rating objects
    Author:
    Ivo Janssen

    • Method Detail

      • isNewTitleValid

        public static boolean isNewTitleValid(java.lang.String newTitle)
        Checks whether a title is viable for a movie. This is done by checking if the entered title is already in use by any of the other movies in the archive
        Parameters:
        newTitle - Title which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        boolean true: Title can safely be used, false: title is already in use by a different movie

      • getValidMovieStatus

        public static java.lang.String[] getValidMovieStatus()
        Get all valid statusses for a movie
        Returns:
        String array of valid movie statusses

      • addMovie

        public static void addMovie(java.util.List<java.lang.String> movieInfo)
        Adds a movie to the program. This incorporates adding it in real-time, adding it to the archive and saving in the database. This way the movie can instantly be used in the program without need for rebooting, but will also be saved to database immidiately to make sure it will be retrieved on next boot up, even when program is exited unexpected. Please note that not using the exact inputs as stated below will result in unintended behaviour. In order to correctly generate the inputs for this method use can be made of AdminBoundary.addMovie()
        Parameters:
        movieInfo - A string-wise description of the movie object in specific order: entry 0 contains the title of the movie. Entry 1 contains the synopsis of the movie. Entry 2 contains the status of the movie. Entry 3 contains the director of the movie. Entry 4 contains the cast of the movie. Entry 5 contains the duration of the movie in minutes. Entry 6 contains the amount of tickets sold for a movie, for a new movie initiate this field as 0. Entry 6 contains the showings of the movie, for a new movie these will be created independently and therefore this field should be entered as an empty string.

      • addShowing

        public static void addShowing(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie,
                              com.moblima.cinema.Cineplex cineplex,
                              com.moblima.cinema.CinemaRoom room,
                              java.util.Date date,
                              boolean isWeekly,
                              int duration)
        Create a showing object, based on its composition of individual data All data can easily be inputted by using the AdminBoundary.addShowing() method.
        Parameters:
        movie - The movie object to which the showing belongs
        cineplex - The cineplex in which the movie will be played.
        room - The specific room within the given cineplex in which the movie will be played
        date - The date and time, given as a Java.Util.Date object at which the movie will be played
        isWeekly - Refers to if this showing will be scheduled weekly, initiating as true will result in automatically creating showings every week at the same time for this movie until the final date specified by current date + forwardScheduling property of the given cineplex
        duration - The total duration the room should be reserved for: this includes advertisements, movie playtime and breaks

      • removeMovie

        public static void removeMovie(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie)
        Remove a movie from the list of movies which are played at the moment. The movie will not be removed from the movie archive, but it's status will automatically be updated to End Of Showing Database will be updated such that on fresh bootup the movie will still exist in the movie archive, but will no longer be visible in the list of current movies playing.
        Parameters:
        movie - The movie object to be removed from the list of movies which are currently playing

      • removeShowing

        public static void removeShowing(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie,
                                 com.moblima.movie.MovieShowing showing)
        Remove 1 particular showing of a movie. If this showing is initiated with the isWeekly parameter as true, then also all showings created based on this one will no longer be scheduled in starting from the next bootup of the program. Please note however that these other showings are still present in the program and will only disappear on reboot of the proram The movie and showings can easily be selected using the AdminBoundary.removeShowing() method.
        Parameters:
        movie - The movie the showing belongs to
        showing - The showing to be removed

      • getMovieFromString

        public static com.moblima.movie.Movie getMovieFromString(java.util.List<java.lang.String> movieInfo)
        Used to create a movie object based on its String-wise definition. Please not that the inputted parameters are really specific and wrong inputs might lead to unintended behaviour.
        Parameters:
        movieInfo - A string-wise description of the movie object in specific order: entry 0 contains the title of the movie. Entry 1 contains the synopsis of the movie. Entry 2 contains the status of the movie. Entry 3 contains the director of the movie. Entry 4 contains the cast of the movie. Entry 5 contains the duration of the movie in minutes. Entry 6 contains the amount of tickets sold for a movie, for a new movie initiate this field as 0. Entry 6 contains the showings of the movie, for a new movie these will be created independently and therefore this field should be entered as an empty string, however when showings are inputted using the correct format as described by the database structure showings will automatically be added to the movieobject.
        Returns:
        The movie object defined by the String-wise composition

      • createWeeklyShowings

        public static java.util.ArrayList<com.moblima.movie.MovieShowing> createWeeklyShowings(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie)
        Create weekly showings for all showings with the characteristic isWeekly = true.
        Parameters:
        movie - The movie object to create weekly showings for
        Returns:
        allShowings: ArrayList of MovieShowing which includes the MovieShowing which will be shown on weekly basis

      • canUserRate

        public static boolean canUserRate(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie,
                                  com.moblima.user.User user)
        Defines if a user can rate a movie. Every user can rate every movie only once
        Parameters:
        movie - movie to check if the user can rate it
        user - the user who tries to give a rating
        Returns:

      • addRating

        public static void addRating(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie,
                             com.moblima.user.User user,
                             double score,
                             java.lang.String description)
        Add a rating to a movie. Inputs can be generated using MovieGoerBoundary.giveRating()
        Parameters:
        movie - Movie to be rated
        user - User who gives the rating
        score - Rating given by the user, this is a double between 1.0 and 5.0
        description - An additional description of the rating specified by the user

      • getAverageRating

        public static double getAverageRating(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie)
        Calculates the average rating of a movie based on the ratings the users have given
        Parameters:
        movie - the movie to calculate the rating for
        Returns:
        average rating of all users, given as a double between 1.0 and 5.0, if no ratings are present 0.0 will be returned

      • retrieveRatingsFromDatabase

        public static void retrieveRatingsFromDatabase(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie)
        Used during initialization of the program after reboot to load all ratings from the database into the program
        Parameters:
        movie - to retrieve the ratings for

      • toDateBaseString

        public static java.lang.String toDateBaseString(com.moblima.movie.Movie movie)
        Converts a movie object to a string which is used to save information to the database
        Parameters:
        movie - to convert to stringwise description
        Returns:
        A string containing all information of the move object to be saved to database
